00056         year       = 2000;

00065 bool Date::DayIsValid() const
00066 {
00067         unsigned monMax = 31;
00068         switch(month)
00069         {
00070                 case 2:
00071                 //"February"
00072                 // Assumes we are not on a leap year.
00073                 // There is room for improvement here.
00074                 monMax = 28;
00075                 break;
00076 
00077                 case 4:
00078                 //"April"
00079                 monMax = 30;
00080                 break;
00081 
00082                 case 6:
00083                 //"June"
00084                 monMax = 30;
00085                 break;
00086 
00087                 case 9:
00088                 //"September"
00089                 monMax = 30;
00090                 break;
00091 
00092                 case 11:
00093                 //"November"
00094                 monMax = 30;
00095                 break;
00096         }
00097 
00098         // Enforce a valid range for the day of the month.
00099         if (dayOfMonth <= monMax && dayOfMonth > 0)
00100         {
00101                 return true;
00102         }
00103         return false;
00104 }

00118 bool Date::SetDayOfMonth(const unsigned& dd)
00119 {
00120         // Keep a backup in case this method fails.
00121         unsigned oldDay = dayOfMonth;
00122         dayOfMonth = dd;
00123 
00124         // Check validity.
00125         if (DayIsValid())
00126         {
00127                 // Success.
00128                 return true;
00129         }
00130 
00131         // Unsuccessful.
00132         dayOfMonth = oldDay; // Revert back to previous value.
00133         return false;
00134 }

00149 bool Date::SetMonth(const unsigned& mm)
00150 {
00151         if (mm <= 12 && mm > 0)
00152         {
00153                 // Keep a backup in case this method fails.
00154                 unsigned oldMonth = month;
00155                 month = mm;
00156 
00157                 // Check validity.
00158                 if (DayIsValid())
00159                 {
00160                         // Success.
00161                         return true;
00162                 }
00163 
00164                 // Unsuccessful.
00165                 month = oldMonth; // Revert back to previous value.
00166         }
00167         return false;
00168 }

00210 {

00212         {
00213                 case 1:
00214                 monthStr = "January";
00215                 break;

00217                 case 2:

00223                 break;

00283 const Date& Date::operator=(const Date& rightDate)
00284 {
00285         // Avoid self-assignment
00286         if (this != &rightDate)
00287         {
00288                 unsigned dom, mon, yr;
00289 
00290                 rightDate.GetDayOfMonth(dom);
00291                 rightDate.GetMonth(mon);
00292                 rightDate.GetYear(yr);
00293 
00294                 SetDayOfMonth(dom);
00295                 SetMonth(mon);
00296                 SetYear(yr);
00297         }
00298         return *this; // The value of the object that was just assigned.
00299 }

00307 bool Date::operator==(const Date& rightDate) const
00308 {
00309         unsigned dom, mon, yr;
00310 
00311         rightDate.GetDayOfMonth(dom);
00312         rightDate.GetMonth(mon);
00313         rightDate.GetYear(yr);
00314 
00315         unsigned myDom, myMon, myYr;
00316 
00317         GetDayOfMonth(myDom);
00318         GetMonth(myMon);
00319         GetYear(myYr);
00320 
00321         if (
00322                 dom == myDom &&
00323                 mon == myMon &&
00324                  yr == myYr
00325                 )
00326         {
00327                 return true;
00328         }
00329         return false;
00330 }
